SENT.plain: Sister chromatid exchanges (SCEs), a sensitive measure of chromosome damage, were counted in peripheral-blood lymphocytes from 10 patients with Behcet's syndrome receiving chlorambucil
Damage was related to both daily dose and duration of therapy and was occurring at a greater rate than its repair
The patient who had been treated the longest and had received the highest total dose also had the highest SCE count
SCE analysis may provide a method for detecting patients at risk from oncogenic effects of cytotoxic drugs
